text: They were efficient, humorous, and it was painless except a slight pinch. Will go there every time from now on.

name: John Sheffield
text: Posted hours are until 4:00pm CST. I arrive today at 3:40pm as the lab is closing for the day. I was told by a staff member that they do not accept walk-ins after a certain "time" to avoid OT. Therefore they would not see me for these labs.  If this is their "policy", it is not publicly posted on their window next to the operating hours.  Unacceptable and unprofessionalism by the staff.

name: Lisa Woodall
text: I have very tiny veins and Labcorp's technicians usually find a good one on the 1st try.  Quick and painless!  Good job!!!

name: Tim Tripp
text: Fast, professional, efficient.  Make an online appointment, it goes a lot faster and it helps them keep you from waiting.

name: L Graves
text: My first experience with LabCorp was a 4 hour long blood test. I was treated professionally by very pleasant people. Making pleasant visit out of this long ordeal. Thank You Ashly and April.

name: Dave M
text:
Staff is very good
The wait is ridiculously long
Just looked at Labcorp profits apparently horribly mismanaged probably the reason they are understaffed

name: Grant Stephens
text: LabCorp is just a small section of the building it lies within, but I only had to wait 5 minutes to take my drug test. I arrived just before 9 AM, and despite being a few minutes early, I was allowed to take my drug test a minute or two early. I only had to wait 5 minutes, and water is provided in the lobby if needed for the test.

name: Patricia Green
text: I have been here one time for a blood test. My experience was that I was treated very courteously by the efficient staff and the visit went very quickly.

name: Charles McCraw
text: I have dealt with this location on two separate ocassions and both times i received swift, curtious service.

name: Kenneth Johnson
text: First time visit and the nurses were very helpful and friendly

name: Cathrine -Cate Summer
text: Wow just had one of the worst sticks in my life this young man in a dirty Med scrub stuck me so hard that I was feeling it 5 minutes later.  The whole office appeared to be very run down

name: Kay Wilson
text: Staff is professional, areas are clean but the process is extremely slow at this location.

name: Mike Campbell
text: You ca forget getting them on a phone.

name: scott mcfarlen
text: Good job

name: Justin Soeung
text: Slow

name: Henry Purvis
text: Why is it that when your back locks up and you’re in so much pain you can’t put your boots on or get in and out of your car that they charge you for seeing a doctor but only hand you off to a nurse practitioner who “can’t prescribe pain medication” I have never had any problems with pain medication and never will. I’ve been a few times in the last 7 years I’ve lived in Florence and they’ve always given me a shot and a prescription for flexoril, steroids and a few pain killers. I’m not going to waste my time with these places anymore. Thanks for nothing med plus.

name: Isabella
text: I was in and out within an hour. I saw Dr. Lee and she was very welcoming and warm. I usually come here at least once a year. I’ve never had a bad experience.

name: Rebecca Kent
text: Run, don’t walk, away from here! They never answer the phone. Front desk staff is horrible they don’t wear masks, and they refused to let me see my primary care provider they sent me to the ER , which the ER told me I should have gone to a primary care provider. They sent me away because it was a Friday and I was an inconvenience. The floors are filthy and it is clear they do not clean. I just left and there was blood on the floor in my exam room!!!!! The PA was very nice, but overall a terrible clinic I will not go back.

name: Sabrina Samano
text: So fast. Truly care about their patients. Had different healthcare providers the past two visits & all have been wonderful!

name: Linda Ealey
text:
I've been going here for years and always paid my bills but recently received a threatening letter (during these awful times with the corona where people are losing jobs and have no income by the way!) that claims this is their 3rd time sending me a notice (it's not! it's the 1st) and that if I don't pay the high amount that I can't afford right now, that I'm no longer able to come back and they will send it to collections.

What a great way to treat your long time paying customers, I'm never going back to Med Plus, it's time for me to find a permanent primary care Dr. anyway.

name: tyler inman
text: I have lived in Florence my whole life and it’s sad to see a doctors office like this. They have the WORST customer service and I mean the WORST. Every time I call, they have a terrible attitude. This is the reason I would rather go somewhere else to visit the doctor. The people at the desk are rude in person and over the phone. They hardly pickup the phone when I do call. I have to call 2-3 times for them to even answer. Not to mention I called last night to get antibody tested and they told me to come up there and they would, but when I drove 30 minutes to get there they told me they couldn’t test me and told me to come back at 7am. They did not close for another hour at that time, so the fact that they couldn’t draw my blood is ridiculous. It frustrates me and if anyone is trying to get tested for covid or visit a doctor in Florence, go somewhere else. Med Plus is not a friendly environment and they do not treat patients nicely. If you work at med plus.. do better.

name: Madison Stewart
text:
The staff and physicians here do not care about their patients. They are the most incompetent people I’ve ever had to deal with. Speaking with Brandi the physician after what happened earlier. Hoping to get a resolution but instead. She has no regard for her patients and defends the incompetence of her staff.
They will kill someone if they already haven’t and they will feel no remorse whatsoever. Do not go here if you have the choice!

name: Rachel S
text: Linda Lee is the best doctor I have ever seen! She listens, is empathetic and knows just how to help. She is obviously very intelligent and is the best at helping you feel your best. I strongly recommend her to anyone that feels they aren’t heard or is needing help medically.

name: Elaine Price
text: I would like to thank the MD who was working the evening of 1/23/20. My son needed stitches. She was very compassionate to him and to me. She listened and even hugged both of us. There is more to this story that I don’t want to share publicly, but let’s just say she was a listening ear and a shoulder to cry on when we needed one. She could have just stitched it up and sent us home. But she took the time to connect with us. She made a true difference in our lives that night. We won’t forget. Thank you.

name: Matthew Nowack
text: This review is a follow-up of my visit to this unpleasant establishment. Where do I start with the utter inconvenience of a visit this has been? The phone call: I decided that I would attempt to book an appointment (like a normal human being) and avoid wasting half of my day to be treated for a basic clinical diagnosis. This business doesn’t take appointments for some reason (because they’re stuck in a 1900’s complacency mentality). Thereafter, I walked into the waiting room and there were only 3 visitors in total (including myself). No surprise there, given the fact that this place is a nightmare. I was rudely informed that I needed to fill out administrative work regarding my visit, and I asked if they already had my file (since I have been here before). They continued to explain that my file was old (it wasn’t) and I needed to update information (not true). Around 1 hour later I was informed that INFORMATION was finalized. At this point, I was the only patient waiting for treatment. After a few more minutes of waiting I was finally called into the Patient’s Entrance. Wow, the holy grail of treating a cold/sinus infection has finally gotten prepared to tell me I need a Z-pack. The doctor proceeded to ask me the same 4 questions 3 separate times. They were rude, they were slow, and they didn’t respect me or my time.

name: Allen B
text: Came in with a severe sinus infection.  Went to another clinic the week before and they told me to go home and sweat it out.  By the time I reached med plus, I was in serious pain and could barely talk.  Everyone was very friendly and didn't waste a bunch of my time asking irrelevant questions.  Dr. Grutzik was very thorough and friendly.  Was starting to feel better within a few hours.  My hats off to Dr. Grutzik and med plus.  Job well done 👍.

name: Stephanie Cornatzer
text: Brandi Ray is wonderful she has been truly a lifesaver for my family and even my sister family. She is so awesome!! All the doctors are great and truly care. And also the best nurse in the world Alli works there and my son wont get a shot from anyone else! Lol they are all great!!!

name: WMBW Love
text:
I get a different Dr. every time I visit, I've been back to back,  most of them really don't know what they're doing, every time I go back I'm getting told something completely different.

I wish they would do x-ray, blood work because I feel like I wouldn't have to go back still sick with the same thing over and over, they'd prescribe me meds and then I'll be back sick with the same thing in about 2 months, it's like they're Dr.'s in training and don't know what they're doing.

Even my sister went, she was still sick after they gave her meds so she had to make another appointment (and pay) and get different meds and she's STILL sick!

I'm just going to find a real Dr. else where, it's not worth it staying sick and wasting money on their service if they don't know what they're talking about, none of them!

And all of the ladies in the back have nasty attitudes (the ones that write down your info and check your weight)

They also wouldn't give me a temporary refill on my diabetic medication until I found a  real Dr., so it was pointless and the bills they sent you are so high!!

name: Jordan
text: Doctor Ferguson is fantastic. Always professional and explains everything thoroughly. Sometimes it’s a little bit of a wait but not often. Worth the wait if they are busy

name: Big Hand Dave
text: In and out very quick. I was very impressed with reception staff. They were quick and professional.  The nurse and nurse practitioner was very quick, thorough and professional. I was in and out in alittle over 20 minutes. Thank you. So much

name: Julia Savoie
text: Did not listen to what I had to say whatsoever

name: Rachel Berry
text: Every time I've been here I've been welcomed with open arms. Doctors and nurses are always sympathetic to my needs. They consistently listen to, and consider my symptoms, and take me seriously. 5/5 Would recommend to everyone.

name: Jimi S
text: Brandi Ray is the Nurse Practitioner for General Family Practice there and she is a literal life saver. She is the utmost kind and caring and genuine medical professional I've ever worked with. She takes the time to really listen and address all my concerns no matter how big or small. And when I'm sick she works me in and has even stayed late to see me. If your looking for a Family Medical Provider she's your woman. I am so thankful for her and her guidance.

name: Major League Carpenter
text: Dr. Lee was amazing, made the experience as enjoyable as possible. Very pleased.

name: Mitchell M
text:
I had a very fast visit and the administrative ladies were wonderful. However, the doctor was talking over me and didn't seem interested in hearing what I had to say. Seemed more like he was ready to get me out than give me an accurate diagnosis.
All in all it was an okay experience.

name: Kaylee Walker
text: Dr. Lee was absolutely amazing with our five year old! It’s so nice to have a kind doctor, who truly loves their work! It makes all the difference!

name: Charlie C
text: Dr Lee is great, willing to listen to your concerns. Always a good feeling when seen here. Nurse practitioner and nurses here are great as well.

name: Josh Berry
text: Dr.Lee is one of the best physicians i’ve been too, she is great. Took awhile to get back there though.

name: Casey Corbett
text: Don’t accept Tricare....military and military families, FYSA

name: Paige Montgomery
text: Slowest doctors office I’ve ever been to. It’s not particularly clean, and when I was getting an IV the woman sticking me did not wear gloves and had sparkly long nails. I have never been to a medical establishment that allows employees to have nails. They were rude and dismissed almost everything I said about my own symptoms and body. I will not be coming back, I don’t recommend others be treated here, either.

name: Maha7951 ___
text: the receptionist was so rude oh my goodness i am so beside myself. It's your job to be nice to patients why work there if you're going to be mean?? If i could give it zero stars i would

name: Kristin Hawkins
text:
I had to go in today because of a fall I had, resulting in a shoulder injury today. I had to wait a little over an hour (it's flu season, so that's to be expected) before I got in. One thing that really left a good impression with me was that the receptionist made note that I wasn't sick and pulled me over to another waiting room away from everyone that was showing cold and flu symptoms...I greatly appreciated that, since I'm a germaphobe and have health related anxiety issues.

Dr. Lee is amazing! She has such a bright personality and she's very wise. She was aware I don't have insurance, so she made sure to check my injury to make sure I didn't need an X-ray, so I wouldn't spend the unnecessary money if I didn't have to.

She sat and talked about some personal issues with me and took the time to show me some exercises I could do for my arm and even some breathing techniques I could do for my anxiety issues. She's a great doctor.

Even though I'm sore and hurting, it was still a really good doctor's visit...and I say that as someone who is terrified of going to the doctors office.

name: Taylor Evans
text: Receptionist in this awful establishment was so unprofessional and very rude! Basically started laughing when telling me they couldn’t process my payment method tonight, due to nobody there to process it. I will never go back and she needs to loose her job.

name: Richard Cornatzer
text: Definitly the best walk in medical facility we have around here the staff is always curtious and professional I've never had any problems with this place or the staff and were very thankful to have doctors like brandi ray and dr lee and dr furgeson to help out when your sick

name: Joe Bama
text: Not the same without Good ol dr Ferguson around as much. He is truly best doc we have had. but new staff has really made improvements still go there when needed.

name: Johnny Vaughn
text: I've been using Med Plus since the mid to late 80s. Alway great care. I've received no-nonsense advice, and exceptional care at reasonable cost every time. Much thanks to the doctors and staff.

name: elmer Pierce
text: Staff is awesome and they do not make you wait all day.

name: Chandra Stewart
text: Quicker then the ER. Doctors where nice and listened to why you were there.

name: Freda Butler
text: Great staff and doctors. I trust them to take care of my family.

name: Steve Merry
text: In and out quickly.  Really good hours.

name: Avery King
text: I would never return to this walk in clinic. I have never felt so disrespected and dealt with such rude people in a professional setting. I would never suggest this place to anyone. After waiting for 30 minutes to see a doctor, they ask me to leave and come back tomorrow because it was after hours (they closed at 8 pm and I was there with all paperwork completed by 7:40.)  Not impressed with a doctor's office thats so rude.

name: Tracy Biggers
text: Walk in and out quickly.

name: Tim Spidel
text: In & Out! Much quicker than the ER and nice doctors.

name: Kelso Morton
text: The doctors are more than professional & kind .

name: Paige Smith
text: This clinic should be closed, and if they continue on the way they are, they will be very soon. Be forewarned that this tacky little "Walk-in Clinic" refuses to see patients who are 65+.  And I do mean AT ALL. They will not tell you that until they see your insurance card; then they will pretend it is because they do not see Medicare patients/take Medicare.  When I pulled out a credit card (a rather upscale one.... ) and offered to pay for the visit then and there and let's forget about Medicare, the little bozo-ette at the window just kept saying, "It's not my fault, it is just the policy." Well,  of course it is not your fault, little Bozo-ette, nothing ever is with flunkies like you.   I eagerly await, soon, reading in the paper that due to a monstrous lawsuit over ageism, that MedPlus has had to close.  Given other reviews of this nasty little place, they will have to close over a  lot of things.  Please post if you ever see a sign in there that says, "We do not treat Black patients," or "No Hispanics allowed."

name: Tabitha Griffith
text: After my visit I called and left message for the Nurse Practitioner to call me back and she didnt. And it was about the prescription she gave me. I will not be back to see her.

name: suyog moon
text: Service is rediculously slow..Doesn't matter how sick is the patient they will make wait for hours..:X:X:X

name: J S
text: This the horrible uncompassionate place I have ever been to I don't recommend going there

name: Steve Willingham
text: Great care

name: Haley Finley
text: Friendly And fast

name: LOUD N PROUD
text: Excellent

name: Ashley T.
text: Really quick in and out. Woman who helped me and did my test was nice and quick. I came in with 3 others behind me and they seemed to get called in not long after. Reviews had me worried for nothing

name: Jake Geveden
text: Horrible, horrible, horrible, horrible experience. They refused to do my test and give me results because the color of my the container I was given and provided back to them was the wrong color.  I am so absolutely frustrated by this awful experience

name: Amy Wedlund
text: I had a great experience at the Montclair location. I highly recommend making an appointment. It is easy to park, easy to check-in, and the staff was incredibly nice and efficient.

name: Amanda J Vaughn
text: The personnel have very little people skills and act like robots. The tech barked orders at me, didn't explain anything, and acted annoyed when I asked for clarification. This was by far my worst experience, just use a different location whenever possible.

name: Stephanie Keller
text: Been to two other Labcorp with no issues. Go to this one and had nothing but problems and it seemed like no one would listen to what I had to say. Then I had an issue after I left and called the office. No one would answer the phone. I have now left a few voicemails over the last few days and they refuse to call me back.

name: Darian Bester
text: No need to make an appointment because they do not follow them. Currently 30 min after my appt time.

name: Sarah McClure
text:
This location is CLOSED. I made an appointment online a week or 2 ago. I showed up and checked in online through the “wait where you’re comfortable” option, where they text you when they’re ready for you to come in. so I waited in my car. After 40 min I decide it’s taking too long. When I get inside the building, they have a sign on their office saying they are temporarily closed?!
That’s fine, except I was never notified of this change after scheduling my appt. Confused as to why they would not inform me of this or why I was allowed to check in for my appointment that apparently didn’t exist anymore the day of. Huge waste of time. Very disappointed in the lack of professionalism and consideration for others.

name: Jessica Dallow
text: Terrible service. Made an appointment, claimed I hadn’t done the proper paperwork so had no information. Rude and unhelpful. Go somewhere else.

name: Gabrielle Pass
text: Employees very rude and unprofessional. Would not recommend.

name: Jamie Polk
text: Absolutely the best service and the lady who did my lab work was the best

name: Daniel Bolus
text: Hours are actually 7:30 to 4:00 Monday through Friday. Tasha was fantastic. In and out with my drug test. I would recommend getting there at around 7:25 so you can get in and out as one of the first people.

name: Megan Waldrop
text: I went here for an employer drug test. I made an appointment for 11 am and arrived about 10:30. I was in and out before my appointment time. Very friendly and professional staff. 10/10 recommend this facility.

name: Jimmy Harris
text: My visit was very pleasant. The wait from front desk to lobby area to in a chair was only about 12 minutes. The staff was really nice and the young lady Tasha, who drew my blood, I didn't feel any pain and she has a wonderful personality......Beautiful person. #Great job Labcorp/Montclair Road

name: John Newton
text: Staff is extremely rude. Seems like they have no idea what’s going on. Avoid going here at all cost. Appointments made online do not matter.

name: David Seidel
text: They have a computer check in, which did not get my info.  So after 20 minutes they asked if the could help me.. then had me check in on the computer again.  Construction in front means you come in thru a side door.

name: A Google User 8
text: I had a great experience considering the circumstances (getting my blood drawn). The lady at the front desk was really friendly to me, then she took my blood and did a great job!! I'll use this facility again if I ever have to again!

name: Austin Green
text: There are no hours for this location. I had to go to yelp and yellowpages to find out the closing time to only discover when I got there that they close earlier than what was referenced. They close at 4 and I got there at 4:05 and even explained that they have no hours of operation up and they wouldn’t not let me take a drug test. For reference the hours are 7am- 4pm and be prepared for terrible service

name: LaToya Maiden
text: The receptionist Lakeisha is rude. The other ladies that sat around her are also rude. I said hello how are you and she basically dismissed me and I  said hello again mind you there are four women sitting in this room and not one of them said hello, how can I help you. Finally the older lady in the room said how can I help you. They're not professional, There is know customer service period and they seem to be angry women by there tones...

name: Face Card
text: Employees are really rude. Customer Service skills should be a priority.!!!! No matter what the field of work is. A simple smile and or saying Good Morning takes a mere split second.

name: April L. Butler
text: Came in for a pre-employment screening with my registration sheet and ID, as I was told to in the LabCorp email.  I was told by the person at the desk once I signed in that she told me in a short tone that she'd call me back up in a minute.  After 30 minutes, she then decides to call me up and take my form and ID (no idea why she couldn't have taken the time to do that when I signed in because no one else was waiting and she was literally just sitting there.  From there, it took another hour, AN HOUR, to even be called back for the screening.  It is absolutely ridiculous to have to wait that long to complete a screening that literally takes 5 minutes.  Changing jobs is hard enough without making your current employer aware by taking a 2 hour lunch break!  They need to reorganize and replace their current staff with ones that understand how hospitality works.

name: K P
text: Very good experience.  Lottie was wonderful, very friendly and helpful!  She also was able to draw the blood painlessly!  Will be back!!

name: Bham Onion
text:
Went there today expecting a issue and they did not let me down.  No sign in sheet so the person keeping the seat warm asked me,  not for my name but for my cell number and someone would call me.
30 minutes later when I still had not been called I went back to the counter to find 3 seat warmers who were all amazed that the previous seat warmer had not done anything past taking my number.

Who runs that place?

name: Joseph Butts
text:
Got a set of cultures done and the prices where:
Aerobic culture: $82
Anaerobic: $160
Sensitivity: $60

How in the world to people pay for this without insurance. That’s ridiculous. This is why people try avoiding the doctors office.

name: Chase Bower
text: The ladies at the front desk are very rude and will not try to help you. They looked for every reason not to see me and did not try to work with me at all. Every time I asked a question she was condescending and unpleasant.

name: ricdady77 Stewart
text: Getting simple access to a person is very difficult. I work at a hospice and wanted to pick up supply for blood draw and spent 30 minutes on the phone and still was not able to reach a person to arrange pick up of tubes for lab draw.

name: zack haynes
text: I have never left a review of any kind on any business but I just felt like I had to say how horrible this place was. Waited 2 hours got skipped in line several times when I finally went to the desk they said “oh we’re sorry you’ll be next” this place is a JOKE. I wouldn’t recommend this place to my worst enemy.

name: B B
text: Long wait, inconvenient hours, and rude unprofessional staff. Botched my screen and had to go to another branch. Totally unacceptable.

name: Shirley Edwards
text: VERY UNKIND AND UNPROFESSIONAL PEOPLE AT THIS LOCATION ... I WILL NOT  GO INTO DETAIL BUT I PASSED MY DRIG TEST THANK GOD ...

name: Carly Speeg
text: The worker of this clinic was absolutely awful.  She was extremely rude to my husband who is preparing for school.  Next time we will go elsewhere.

name: Graham Pointer
text: I really like the people who work there. They always treat me fair, and they respect my time.

name: Arthur Heraud
text:
An hour wait in the lobby. Finally it took me 30 seconds to leave a urine sample for school

Technicians demeanor was that of a probation officer

Maybe they were just understaffed but regardless

name: Tonya Lawson
text: How hard is it to have a human answer the phone?!?

name: Skylar Alexander-Brown
text: Don't bother making an appointment

name: Madison Jenkins
text: They were very rude and extremely disorganized. They do not greet you or make eye contact and no smiles anywhere. Very demanding ! Would not reccommend this place

name: vkutz
text: Surprised that an office that supplies lab services for a multitude of medical offices would be so incredibly small and horrifically disorganized. Exceptional rudeness of staff only makes matters worse. If you can have your blood drawn at your doctor's office, or another source, by all means do so!

resp.text: We apologize if this was your experience and thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will be forwarding this feedback to our leadership team in the region for a follow-up with our staff.

name: brandon mccluskey
text: Sorry pathetic cheap medical office.      Require face mask but will not and does not supply one.   All I went for was a drug screen.  Burnt wasted trip.  Have better chance in a back woods medical place this this podunk pathetic excuse of an establishment

resp.text: We apologize if this was your experience, Brandon, and thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will be forwarding this to our leadership team in the region for a follow-up with our staff.

name: Tami Minor
text: I go there for my biometrics each year.  The technicians are professional, efficient, and kind. I have never had to wait longer than a couple of minutes.  I have never had a bad experience there.

name: Cookee The cook
text: Don't bother making an appointment. Several folks called in ahead of me with no appointment, although  (appointments have priority ).

name: Michelle Jones
text: Very friendly staff! Quick and easy!

name: Kristine Fitts
text:
The young lady who pulled my labs this morning was very friendly, very professional, spoke to me with care/kindness and a great sticker!
I believe her name is Tyere....the lab is super clean and easy to find. I highly recommend it!

resp.text: Thank you for sharing this feedback, Kristine! We will be passing this along to our leadership team in the region so we can recognize Tyere for her hard work.

name: Patrick Smith
text: Trying to verify a billing issue for years, can’t get in touch with them during business hours. Even the automated system is awful, they are open until 5pm I can’t get an answer at 4:10pm. Am I doing something wrong?

resp.text: We apologize for any frustration or inconvenience this may have caused, Patrick, and thank you for bringing this to our attention. Please contact our Customer Service team at 1-866-697-8378 as they are best suited to assist you further.

name: charles carter
text: This isn't a review about diagnostics. On Wednesday evening Nov 18 one of your employees pulled up at Midtown Mall, parked car in an area that isn't intended for parking, put the car blinkers on, and casually went inside a business and shopped for 20 minutes while he/she was blocking traffic. If you employ such selfish and irresponsible people I certainly would not trust you to perform any diagnostic services.

resp.text: We apologize if we have not met your expectations, Charles.

name: Brian Williams
text: Good experience.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing, Brian!

name: zerhet zdfbzfb
text: Abusive staff

resp.text: We apologize if this was your experience and thank you for bringing this to our attention. We will be forwarding this to our leadership team in the region for a follow-up with our staff.

name: juanita duff
text:
I live in Greene county. Couldn't find the address thru GPS
Called an 866 area code number,  no tuscaloosa number listed.  Woman on phone couldn't hep me find place either After an hour driving around,  gave up.  Will ask my Dr.  to send me to Lab Co.  What kind of company doesn't provide a local number?

resp.text: We apologize if this was your experience, Juanita. Our Patient Advocacy team is the best contact to have any questions or concerns directly addressed: patientadvocacy@questdiagnostics.com.

name: Robin Hemphill
text: Tried to go to this location at 1:50 on Friday. Hours are until 2pm they were already closed.  I pay insurance and your salary and you don’t have The decency to stay ope until 2pm on a Friday!!!!   Really???  This truly is the worse company if it wasn’t for insurance companies you wouldn’t have a job.   We had an order in your system to go there but you can’t stay open long enough to allow business.  Don’t go here they are horrible. If I could give zero stars I would.

name: Sean Craig
text:
READ ALL OF THIS
My wife was very sick. The doctor sent my wife to Quest Diagnostics because it was on our insurance. Sure enough the entrance to Quest was plastered with United Healthcare posters. The doctor ordered 3 specific tests. The Quest technician told my wife that she couldn't run one of the tests because she was out of the product she needed and would have to order it. She said she would call us the next morning and schedule another visit. The next day came and went. No phone call. I tried to call Quest at about 3pm. The number wasn't local. There is no local number. I got a Customer Service Phone Rep. She quickly determined that there wasn't anything she could do to help me and told me as much. I said "I need help". She began explaining why she couldn't help me. I asked who is in charge? A manager? She put me on hold. I finally got a manager. Charmaine. She was much more helpful. She looked up the information and examined the matter. PROBLEM: The local lab was already closed! They close at 2pm! It was Friday. Have to wait til Monday! Very sick. Ulcerative Colitis. I hung up. I Called my employers insurance manager. She sent us to Labcorp. Labcorp is great. They're not out of anything. They have a local number. They have professional people. I advise you to save yourself a lot of needless pain and suffering. Make them send you to Labcorp.

resp.text: We apologize for any frustration or disappointment this may have caused, Sean, and thank you for taking the time to share this feedback with us. Please contact our Patient Advocacy team with additional information so we can address any concerns directly: 610-454-6075 or patientadvocacy@questdiagnostics.com.

name: scotty probasco
text: Staff is nice but their organizational skills are servely lacking. They have a hard time finding my orders. Every. Single. Time.

name: Emerson L. Curtis
text: They made me wait half an hour before they told me they couldn't do the drug test, even though they knew what I needed the second I walked in the door.

name: Lora Yeager-Smith
text: Always prompt and courteous when I go for blood draw!

name: Mary Capp
text:
I am compelled to respond to the request for reviews of LabFirst. The facility located at Grandview Medical Center Birmingham, Alabama is convenient but sorely lacking in training, organization, communications and customer service.
The facility lacks on going training of their employees as to procedural policies  both in completing physician's orders to what , when, who do you pay for services rendered.
I do not hold the employees themselves responsible but I do hold their employer responsible for the horrific and obvious lack on procedural training so that the actual front line workers are not put in embarrassing and confusing positions along with the patients they serve.
Perhaps this review will go without a response but hopefully, the personnel responsible for training may be enlightened.

name: Lele mc
text: First the girl that took his blood forgot to put the cap on the end of the needle so my husband leaked blood all over the floor before she caught her mistake. Second, after 150,00 in medical bills, this is the only place that wouldn't give us a self-pay discount and I compared their prices to a list - they overcharged by 50% for every lab they took. So if you care about competence or you don't have insurance - steer clear of this lab.

name: Timothy Moore
text:
Places like this shouldn't be able to collect on any balance they haven't billed to the insurance or to the patient within a reasonable period of time like maybe 90 days!

Sends me a bill from some lab they say they did SEVEN MONTHS AGO!  The broken English speaking billing lady simply says it has been "pending in their system" for this 7 months.  They never filed any insurance ( a problem in itself that makes the bill $621 when it will likely ultimately be less than $20) and they never sent me a bill before now.  This is the second time they've done this except last time the bill was almost a year old!

name: Becky Ragsdale
text: Friendly and professional at the Gadsden location

name: Sandra JS Coleman
text: LabFirst is not professional with billing. After multiple attempts to pay a bill and further complications as a result of them not accepting payment, I will probably have to find a new doctor after 18 years with my specialist - or require her to send for my blood work elsewhere. Such a shame. The phlebotomists are probably great, but I will not use them again if at all possible.

name: Casey Benefield
text:
Horrible billing practices. Date of service: 8/2/2018. My first statement: 6/4/2019. The last day to get payments from my FSA was 3/1/2019.
They caused me extra expenses, and have an offshored call center now, which clearly does not care.

The billing statement came 10 months later, AND they never told me they were having insurance trouble, which is what they claimed was an issue. That's excessive. They never mailed me anything.

I had to FORCE them to look in their system to see if there were ANY other mailings, and the call center rep admitted, yeah this is the ONLY thing they mailed.

Sure, Grandview Medical uses LabFirst as an outsource provider, but you know what? If this is not fixed/written off now 10 months later, as in refunded and written off, I will no longer do business with Grandview/LabFirst, and will encourage others to avoid them.

There is a point where Grandview has to have some STANDARDS for vendors.

name: Sun Sonja Johnson
text: The lab workers are very nice& Friendly. Stacy(msp) I might have not spelled her name correctly but she was a very nice person that answered my questions about my lab work& paperwork. Thanks!

name: DAVID STEIN
text: Very efficient.  Thank you.
